Validate implementation against domain requirements before deployment
Select stack based on team expertise, project requirements, and long-term maintainability rather than latest trends
Use stack-specific naming conventions consistently across all code artifacts to improve readability and tooling support
Configure linters and formatters early in project setup to enforce code quality automatically
Reference stack capabilities when assigning agents and skills to ensure appropriate tooling is available
Keep version registries synchronized with actual package versions used in projects to prevent compatibility issues
Document stack selection rationale in project README to help future maintainers understand decisions
Use framework-specific blueprints when available (e.g., python-fastapi) rather than generic stack blueprints
Validate that suggested agents and skills from stack capabilities are actually implemented before referencing them

anti_patterns.name: Stack Mismatch
anti_patterns.problem: Selecting a stack that doesn't match team expertise or project requirements leads to slow development and poor code quality
anti_patterns.fix: Evaluate team skills, project complexity, and ecosystem maturity before selecting. Use stack-capabilities.json to compare options

anti_patterns.name: Tool Fragmentation
anti_patterns.problem: Using different linters/formatters across projects in the same stack creates inconsistent code styles and CI/CD complexity
anti_patterns.fix: Standardize on one set of tools per stack organization-wide. Document choices in stack-capabilities.json

anti_patterns.name: Framework Over-Engineering
anti_patterns.problem: Choosing heavyweight frameworks (e.g., Spring Boot) for simple projects adds unnecessary complexity and slower startup
anti_patterns.fix: Match framework complexity to project needs. Use lightweight alternatives (FastAPI, Express) for simple APIs

anti_patterns.name: Naming Convention Drift
anti_patterns.problem: Allowing inconsistent naming conventions within a stack breaks IDE support, searchability, and team understanding
anti_patterns.fix: Enforce stack naming conventions via linters and code review. Reference stack-capabilities.json as source of truth

anti_patterns.name: Version Registry Staleness
anti_patterns.problem: Not updating version-registry.json when upgrading packages leads to outdated recommendations and compatibility issues
anti_patterns.fix: Keep version-registry.json synchronized with actual package versions. Use automated checks to detect drift
